BLOCK_MESSAGE.title: Block Message
BLOCK_MESSAGE.description: Message displayed to users when their content is blocked. Should be informative but not reveal security mechanisms.

ALLOW_MAX.title: Allow Maximum Score
ALLOW_MAX.description: Maximum security score (0-100) for content to be allowed without any processing. Lower values = stricter security.

SL_MIN.title: Light Sanitization Minimum
SL_MIN.description: Score threshold where light content removal begins. Should be higher than Allow Max to avoid gaps.

SL_MAX.title: Light Sanitization Maximum
SL_MAX.description: Score threshold where light sanitization ends and heavy sanitization begins.

SH_MIN.title: Heavy Sanitization Minimum
SH_MIN.description: Score threshold where aggressive content removal begins. Should align with Light Sanitization Max.

SH_MAX.title: Heavy Sanitization Maximum
SH_MAX.description: Score threshold where heavy sanitization ends and blocking begins.

BLOCK_MIN.title: Block Minimum Score
BLOCK_MIN.description: Minimum score to block content entirely. Should align with Heavy Sanitization Max.

BLOOM_ROUTE_TO_AC.title: Bloom Filter Additional Checks Threshold
BLOOM_ROUTE_TO_AC.description: Percentage match (0-100) in bloom filter to trigger additional validation. Lower values = more sensitive early detection.

BLOOM_HARD_BLOCK.title: Bloom Filter Hard Block Threshold
BLOOM_HARD_BLOCK.description: Percentage match (0-100) in bloom filter to immediately block without further analysis. Higher values = fewer false positives.

BLOOM_REQUIRE_EXTRA.title: Require Additional Signals
BLOOM_REQUIRE_EXTRA.description: When enabled, requires multiple indicators before blocking content. Reduces false positives but may miss sophisticated attacks.

BLOOM_PHRASE_BONUS.title: Bloom Filter Phrase Match Bonus
BLOOM_PHRASE_BONUS.description: Points (0-100) added to suspicious score for each exact dangerous phrase match. Higher values make phrase detection more aggressive. Each matched phrase adds this many points to the total score.

BLOOM_M.title: Bloom Filter Size
BLOOM_M.description: Bits allocated (8192-131072) for bloom filter. Larger sizes reduce false positives but use more memory.

BLOOM_K.title: Bloom Filter Hash Functions
BLOOM_K.description: Number of hash functions (3-10) used in bloom filter. More functions increase accuracy but slow processing.

REMOVE_ZERO_WIDTH.title: Remove Invisible Characters
REMOVE_ZERO_WIDTH.description: Strips zero-width Unicode characters often used for obfuscation. Recommended for security.

COLLAPSE_WS.title: Normalize Whitespace
COLLAPSE_WS.description: Merges multiple spaces, tabs, and newlines into single spaces. Prevents whitespace-based obfuscation.

DECODE_ENTITIES.title: Decode HTML Entities
DECODE_ENTITIES.description: Converts HTML entities (< to <, etc.) to reveal hidden content. Essential for web input security.

UNICODE_FORM.title: Unicode Normalization Form
UNICODE_FORM.description: Strength of Unicode normalization. NFKC (recommended) is most aggressive against obfuscation.

HEAVY_MAX_REMOVAL.title: Heavy Sanitization Max Removal
HEAVY_MAX_REMOVAL.description: Maximum percentage (0-100) of text that can be removed during heavy sanitization. Higher values allow more aggressive cleaning.

HEAVY_POLICY.title: Over-limit Sanitization Policy
HEAVY_POLICY.description: Action when sanitization would exceed max removal percentage.

options.sanitize_if_exceeds: Continue sanitizing even if exceeds limit (recommended)
options.block_if_exceeds: Block content if would exceed removal limit

NGRAM_MIN.title: N-gram Minimum Size
NGRAM_MIN.description: Shortest substring (2-10 chars) to analyze for patterns. Smaller values catch more patterns but increase processing time.

NGRAM_MAX.title: N-gram Maximum Size
NGRAM_MAX.description: Longest substring (2-20 chars) to analyze for patterns. Larger values catch longer patterns but increase memory usage.

NGRAM_PREFIX_WINDOW.title: N-gram Prefix Window
NGRAM_PREFIX_WINDOW.description: Number of characters (100-10000) to analyze at the beginning of input for pattern matching.

PII_ENABLED.title: Enable PII Detection
PII_ENABLED.description: Automatically detects and redacts personally identifiable information (PII) using Microsoft Presidio NLP engine with dual-language support (Polish + International entities). Detects 11+ entity types including PESEL, NIP, REGON, credit cards, emails, phone numbers, IP addresses, and more.

PII_DETECTION_MODE.title: PII Detection Mode
PII_DETECTION_MODE.description:
Selects detection sensitivity profile:
• High Security: Banking/Healthcare (CREDIT_CARD ≥0.75, PESEL ≥0.35, EMAIL ≥0.50) - more false positives, catches ambiguous patterns
• Balanced: Most B2B apps (CREDIT_CARD ≥0.85, PESEL ≥0.50, EMAIL ≥0.70) - recommended default
• High Precision: UX-critical apps (CREDIT_CARD ≥0.95, PESEL ≥0.70, EMAIL ≥0.90) - fewer false positives, may miss some PII

Each mode uses different per-entity confidence thresholds optimized for specific use cases.

PII_FALLBACK_TO_REGEX.title: Fallback to Regex Patterns
PII_FALLBACK_TO_REGEX.description: When enabled, uses legacy regex patterns from pii.conf if Presidio API is offline or fails. Provides fallback protection but regex-based detection is less accurate than NLP. Disable for API-only detection with strict validation.

PII_CONTEXT_ENHANCEMENT.title: Context-Aware Detection
PII_CONTEXT_ENHANCEMENT.description: Analyzes surrounding text for keywords like 'PESEL:', 'email:', 'card number:' to improve detection accuracy. Context clues reduce false positives by validating that numbers/patterns appear in PII-related contexts. Recommended for Polish language inputs.

PII_API_TIMEOUT_MS.title: Presidio API Timeout
PII_API_TIMEOUT_MS.description: Request timeout (1000-10000ms) for Presidio API calls. Lower values fail faster but may timeout on complex inputs. Higher values allow thorough analysis but slow response. Default 3000ms handles most inputs. If timeout occurs, fallback to regex (if enabled) or block request.

PII_REDACTION_MODE.title: PII Redaction Format
PII_REDACTION_MODE.description:
How to redact detected PII in output:
• Replace: [EMAIL], [PESEL], [CARD] - human-readable, best for audit logs/debugging
• Hash: SHA-256 hash (a8b3f2c1d4...) - preserves uniqueness, good for analytics/ML training
• Mask: ****59 (last 2 digits visible) - user-friendly, shows partial info for validation

All modes redact sensitive data but differ in output format and use case suitability.

MAX_INPUT_LENGTH.title: Maximum Input Length
MAX_INPUT_LENGTH.description: Maximum number of characters allowed in user input before rejection. Inputs exceeding this limit are blocked by the Early Block mechanism before 3-branch detection begins. Prevents denial-of-service attacks and resource exhaustion. Higher values allow longer messages but increase processing time and memory usage.

ARBITER_WEIGHT_PATTERN.title: Pattern Detection Weight
ARBITER_WEIGHT_PATTERN.description: Weight for Branch A (Pattern Detection) in Arbiter scoring (0.0-1.0). Controls how much the pattern matching results influence the final decision. Higher weight increases importance of regex-based detection. Default: 0.4 (40% influence)

ARBITER_WEIGHT_HEURISTICS.title: Heuristics Analysis Weight
ARBITER_WEIGHT_HEURISTICS.description: Weight for Branch B (Heuristics Analysis) in Arbiter scoring (0.0-1.0). Controls how much the heuristic analysis (entropy, token frequency, encoding obfuscation) influences the final decision. Higher weight increases importance of behavioral analysis. Default: 0.3 (30% influence)

ARBITER_WEIGHT_SEMANTIC.title: Semantic Analysis Weight
ARBITER_WEIGHT_SEMANTIC.description: Weight for semantic/vector analysis in Arbiter scoring (0.0-1.0). Controls how much the semantic similarity analysis influences the final decision. Higher weight increases importance of meaning-based detection. Default: 0.2 (20% influence)

ARBITER_WEIGHT_LLM_GUARD.title: NLP Analysis Weight
ARBITER_WEIGHT_LLM_GUARD.description: Weight for Branch C (NLP analysis / llm_guard) in Arbiter scoring (0.0-1.0). Controls how much the NLP safety classifier (based on Llama Prompt Guard) influences the final decision. Higher weight increases importance of AI-based validation. Default: 0.1 (10% influence)

ARBITER_BLOCK_SCORE.title: Arbiter Block Threshold
ARBITER_BLOCK_SCORE.description: Combined score threshold for BLOCK decision (0-100). When weighted score from all branches exceeds this value, input is completely rejected. Should be higher than SANITIZE_HEAVY threshold. Default: 85

ARBITER_CONFIDENCE_MIN.title: Minimum Confidence Threshold
ARBITER_CONFIDENCE_MIN.description: Minimum confidence required for Arbiter decision (0.0-1.0). If confidence falls below this threshold, system defaults to conservative action (BLOCK or SANITIZE_HEAVY). Higher values ensure more certain decisions but may increase false positives. Default: 0.6 (60%)

ARBITER_BOOST_CONSERVATIVE_ENABLED.title: Enable Conservative Boost
ARBITER_BOOST_CONSERVATIVE_ENABLED.description: Enable score boost when all degraded branches agree on threat. When multiple detection branches fail or degrade but still detect a threat, this boost increases the combined score to ensure conservative blocking. Helps prevent bypasses when some detection mechanisms are unavailable.

ARBITER_BOOST_CONSERVATIVE_MIN.title: Conservative Boost Minimum Score
ARBITER_BOOST_CONSERVATIVE_MIN.description: Minimum score addition when conservative boost is triggered (0-100). This value is added to the combined score when all degraded branches agree on a threat. Higher values make the system more aggressive in blocking when confidence is low. Default: 20

ARBITER_BOOST_SEMANTIC_ENABLED.title: Enable Semantic Boost
ARBITER_BOOST_SEMANTIC_ENABLED.description: Enable score boost when semantic analysis detects high similarity to known jailbreak patterns. When vector embeddings show strong similarity to historical attacks, this boost increases the threat score. Helps catch novel variations of known attacks.

ARBITER_BOOST_SEMANTIC_THRESHOLD.title: Semantic Boost Threshold
ARBITER_BOOST_SEMANTIC_THRESHOLD.description: Cosine similarity threshold for semantic boost activation (0.0-1.0). When semantic analysis exceeds this similarity to known attacks, the boost is applied. Higher values require closer match to historical jailbreaks. Default: 0.85 (85% similarity)

ARBITER_BOOST_SEMANTIC_VALUE.title: Semantic Boost Value
ARBITER_BOOST_SEMANTIC_VALUE.description: Score addition when semantic boost is triggered (0-100). This value is added to the combined score when input shows high semantic similarity to known jailbreaks. Higher values make semantic detection more impactful. Default: 15

ARBITER_BOOST_UNANIMOUS_ENABLED.title: Enable Unanimous Agreement Boost
ARBITER_BOOST_UNANIMOUS_ENABLED.description: Enable score boost when all active branches agree on threat detection. When Pattern, Heuristics, Semantic, and NLP Analysis all detect a threat, this boost significantly increases the combined score. Strong indicator of genuine attack.

ARBITER_BOOST_UNANIMOUS_MAX.title: Unanimous Boost Maximum Score
ARBITER_BOOST_UNANIMOUS_MAX.description: Maximum combined score when unanimous boost is triggered (0-100). When all branches agree on a threat, the score is elevated to at least this value. Typically set to BLOCK threshold to ensure blocking. Default: 95

ARBITER_BOOST_LLM_VETO_ENABLED.title: Enable NLP Analysis Veto
ARBITER_BOOST_LLM_VETO_ENABLED.description: Enable veto power for the NLP analysis branch when it detects high-confidence jailbreak. When the Llama Prompt Guard-based classifier reports very high threat score, it can override lower scores from other branches. Final safety layer using advanced ML model.

ARBITER_BOOST_LLM_VETO_THRESHOLD.title: NLP Analysis Veto Threshold
ARBITER_BOOST_LLM_VETO_THRESHOLD.description: NLP analysis score threshold for veto activation (0-100). When the llm_guard branch score exceeds this value, it can override other branch decisions and force BLOCK action. Should be high to avoid false positives (only very confident ML predictions). Default: 90

PLUGIN_WEBHOOK_URL.title: Browser Extension Webhook URL
PLUGIN_WEBHOOK_URL.description: API endpoint where browser extension sends prompts for validation. Extension makes POST requests to this URL with user input and receives ALLOW/BLOCK/SANITIZE decisions. Must be accessible from user browsers. Auto-refreshes every 5 minutes. Example: http://localhost/ui/api/browser-filter

PLUGIN_GUI_URL.title: Web UI Base URL
PLUGIN_GUI_URL.description: Base URL where Vigil Guard Web UI is hosted. Browser extension fetches configuration from this address on install and every 5 minutes. Users can also manually refresh via plugin popup. Must be accessible from user browsers. Example: http://localhost/ui

PLUGIN_ENABLED.title: Enable Browser Plugin Integration
PLUGIN_ENABLED.description: Global toggle for browser extension functionality. When disabled, extension enters fail-open mode: all prompts are automatically allowed without validation. Useful for emergency bypass or maintenance. Browser extensions auto-detect this setting within 5 minutes. Default: enabled

RETENTION_EVENTS_RAW_TTL.title: Raw Events Retention (days)
RETENTION_EVENTS_RAW_TTL.description: How long to keep events_raw table data (raw webhook inputs for debugging). Data older than this TTL is automatically deleted by ClickHouse. Lower values save disk space but reduce debug history. Typical: 90 days for 3-month audit trail. Range: 1-3650 days.

RETENTION_EVENTS_PROCESSED_TTL.title: Processed Events Retention (days)
RETENTION_EVENTS_PROCESSED_TTL.description: How long to keep events_processed table data (full analysis with scoring and decisions). Data older than this TTL is automatically deleted. This is your main audit log and investigation history. Typical: 365 days for 1-year compliance. Range: 1-3650 days.

RETENTION_WARN_THRESHOLD.title: Disk Usage Warning Threshold (%)
RETENTION_WARN_THRESHOLD.description: Disk usage percentage that triggers warning alerts (1-100%). When ClickHouse volume exceeds this threshold, system sends warnings to administrators. Set below critical threshold to get early notice before disk fills. Must be less than critical threshold. Typical: 80%

RETENTION_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD.title: Disk Usage Critical Threshold (%)
RETENTION_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD.description: Disk usage percentage that triggers critical alerts (1-100%). When ClickHouse volume exceeds this threshold, system is at risk of data loss or service outage. Immediate action required to free space or expand volume. Must be greater than warning threshold. Typical: 90%
